result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C Tremain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. No contact with any known drug dealers or users. Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Defendant Joseph C Tremain in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Joseph C Tremain.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: GUILTY. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 year initial confinement with 1 year extended supervision consecutive to current sentence. 

Conditions of extended supervision:
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with any known drug dealer or users. 
Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP.
Defendant is eligible for SAP.
